thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho would rather Manchester United were in the Europa League than nothing at all – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho would rather Manchester United were in the Europa League than nothing at all
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho would rather Manchester United were in the Europa League than nothing at all

author: markbrus88
title: Jose Mourinho would rather Manchester United were in the Europa League than nothing at all
text:
Jose Mourinho wouldn’t mind another stab at the Europa League (Picture: Getty) Jose Mourinho has made the surprise claim that he’d rather Manchester United were playing in the Europa League again next season instead of no European football at all.
Bizarre scenes at Old Trafford as Phil Jones needs inhaler minutes after coming on The former Chelsea boss has been scathing in his views about the competition in the past, and admits he would still much rather be back in the Champions League next term.
United have been in the Europa League this season and Mourinho has often complained about fixture pile-up due to the extra games on Thursdays and occasional long journeys.
Mourinho has previously only been concerned by the bigger trophies (Picture: Getty) However, in a change of tune on the tournament, the Portuguese now says it’s better to be in Europe’s second tier than have no European football at all.
‘I don’t (want to be in the Europa League next season) but I prefer to be in it than not to be,’ he told Gary Lineker on BBC 2’s The Premier League Show.
More: Football We'll lose to Middlesbrough on Sunday! Mourinho goes on one of his weirdest rants yet 
The glory years are never coming back, Mourinho tells United fans 
Man Utd 1-0 Rostov player ratings: Mata winner sends United through 
Manchester United fixtures Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar
West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Swansea (H) – Sun 30 Apr
Arsenal (A) – Sat – 6 May
‘And next season if we don’t play Champions League I think we have to play Europa League and try to win it.’
Just four years ago, upon taking the Chelsea job shortly after they’d won the Europa League, Mourinho said: ‘I don’t want to win the Europa League. It would be a big disappointment for me.
‘I don’t want my players to feel the Europa League is our competition.’
MORE: Mourinho: I'd have never sold these Man Utd stars
